reuters.unknown: V RM f reute r f AM REAGAN IMPACT NEWS A NALYSIS

text.title: TOWER REPORT DIMINISHES REAGAN S HOPES OF REBOUND
text.author: By Michael Gelb Reuters
text.body: The Tower Commission report says President Reagan ignorant much Iran arms deal just ends his prospects regaining political dominance Washington political analysts This certification incompetence private political analyst Stephen Hess told Reuters commenting on Tower report made public today It s as if he went before professional licensing board denied credentials one most direct criticisms board chairman John Tower longtime Reagan supporter former Republican senator Texas told press conference The president clearly did understand nature operation report lent credence to widespread opinion Washington Reagan full command government particularly damaging because prepared by board Republican president s own choosing three member panel made up Tower former National Security Adviser Brent Scowcroft former Secretary State Edmund Muskie does carry partisan taint criticism Congress controlled by Democratic party We re falling by our own hand one Republican political strategist What can we say except we re sorry we won t do again strategist who works one his party s top presidential contenders asked to be identified report like an anvil falling on us Hess Brookings Institution public policy study group report final blow to Reagan s hopes regaining upper hand he once dealings Congress press Washington bureaucracy report may also undermine standing Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger Secretary State George Shultz who report suggests were more interested keeping their own skirts clean than supporting president They protected record as to their own positions on issue They were energetic attempting to protect president consequences White House chief staff Donald Regan former Central Intelligence Agency Director William Casey also received strong criticism but blows were expected their cases Regan expected to resign or be fired shortly savaged allegedly failing both to help Reagan conduct Iran initiative to avoid chaos disclosure process Casey who underwent surgery removal cancerous brain tumor December already resigned health reasons month This story people who came up somewhat short being heroes Tower told reporters While Reagan retains considerable constitutional powers including command armed forces right to veto legislation analysts say be difficult him to retake control country s policy agenda particularly Congress controlled by Democrats crucial remaining question they whether man street forsake Reagan over affair Although his job approval rating fallen as much as twenty percentage points some opinion polls since arms deal Iran became public November his personal popularity still relatively high Los Angeles Times poll released earlier week showed just pct those surveyed thought Reagan control government but pct still thought he doing good job as president American Enterprise Institute analyst William Schneider Democrat says Reagan s loss support among Washington power brokers could be offset by continued backing public In past he been able to go around power elite by appealing directly to public Schneider Reagan again plead his case way televised address next week But one top Republican strategist warned against expecting dramatic turnaround The White House to avoid building expectations cannot be met strategist who requested anonymity They to recognize there no quick fix Analysts also point out Reagan s personal popularity always translated into public backing his policies They note he dramatically rebuffed November s elections when voters rejected his appeals restored control Senate to Democrats

text.author: By Kathleen Hays Reuters
text.body: A surprise pct drop U S January durable goods orders points to slowdown capital spending could presage lackluster real growth U S economy first quarter economists total orders excluding volatile defense sector falling record pct economists agreed report painted bleak picture U S economy But they stressed tax reform laws may be primary factor behind drop orders business capital investment It s rather gloomy outlook economy David Wyss Data Resources Inc I m particularly impressed by pct drop non defense capital goods orders because may be sign businesses reacting more adversely to tax reform than we thought Commerce Department pointed out record pct decline new orders machinery led by declines office computing equipment orders Economists drop computer orders may been response to lengthening depreciation schedules end investment tax credit under new tax laws It s more expensive to invest than used to be so people just aren t doing as much Wyss Increases durable goods orders at year s end reinforced view businesses anticipated changing tax laws economists November durable goods orders rose pct December s increased pct revised upwards previously reported pct But most acknowledged huge January drop caused by more than tax reform The wash out took place January far greater than actual gains took place November December Bill Sullivan Dean Witter Reynolds Inc The economy weakening bent to early year The report definitely points to very sluggish capital spending over next couple quarters Donald Maude Midland Montagu Capital Markets Inc Maude pointed to continuing decline order backlogs as evidence outlook new orders improving November order backlogs rose pct but December they fell pct January pct he It suggests orders pipeline depleting may quickly translate to drop production Midland Montagu s Maude Wyss cautioned too much should be made January s report given other reports reflected strength But he acknowledged decline occurred despite pct rise defense orders compared pct decline December He also noted there pct drop January shipments compared pct rise December Given these numbers there s no reason Fed to tighten Data Resources Wyss But there s no reason to ease unless we see more numbers like Fed wait see he added Sullivan predicted Fed ease by Easter People aren t talking recession or Fed easing now but Fed to ease to ensure global growth

reuters.unknown: C f reute d f BC SENATORS INTRODUCE EX

text.title: SENATORS INTRODUCE EXPORT LICENSING REFORM BILL
text.body: Sens Alan Cranston D Cal Daniel Evans R Wash they introduced export licensing reform legislation could save U S companies hundreds thousands dollars annually Our emphasis two fold Decontrol de license items where such actions endanger our national security eliminate Department Defense s de facto veto authority over licensing process Cranston Our reforms should reduce licensing requirements by to pct he told reporters I am convinced more rational licensing process boost exports U S export controls intended to deny Eastern bloc countries access to technology could further their military capabilities By refocusing our control resources on higher levels technology technology truly critical we do better job preventing diversion critical technology to our adversaries while promoting more exports Cranston We cannot expect to continue to play leading role new technology development future if we unduly restrict activities U S firms world market place Evans told reporters

text.title: ARGENTINA COULD SUSPEND DEBT PAYMENTS DEPUTY
text.body: Argentina could suspend payments on foreign debt if creditor banks reject billion dlr loan request to meet growth targets ruling Radical Party Deputy Raul Baglini told local radio station Argentina does discard use a moratorium if negotiations do produce result guarantees growth country he added Baglini observer at Argentina s negotiations New York steering committee creditors banks told Radio del Plata telephone interview banks were divided on loan request Baglini as result today s scheduled second day talks been postponed He Argentina prepared to follow example Brazil week declared moratorium on interest payments large portion billion dlr foreign debt Argentina s prime objective renegotiating debt to maintain growth been targeted at four pct Baglini Debtor nations should to take their own pockets their commercial balance to meet interest payments he added

text.title: KEY U S TAX WRITERS SEEK ESTATE TAX CURBS
text.body: The chairmen senior Republican members House Senate tax writing committees proposed legislation to curb estate tax deduction on sales stock to employee stock ownership plan proposal raise federal revenues billion dlrs over fiscal year period to If adopted by Congress effect all transactions after Sept plan proposed by House Ways Means Committee Chairman Dan Rostenkowski D Ill Rep John Duncan R Tenn Senate Finance Committee Chairman Lloyd Bentsen D Tex Sen Bob Packwood R Ore statement Rostenkowski estate tax deduction enacted year as part tax reform bill too broad cost governmet seven billion dlrs over four years narrower deduction cost government less than dlrs same years He designed to avoid sham transactions allowed estates to avoid taxes by transferring stock to ESOPs Senate Finance Committee chairman Lloyd Bentsen statement The Tax Reform Act contains provision allows many wealthy individuals to avoid federal estate tax entirely when they die He added The provision intended to encourage estates to sell stock to employee stock ownership plans as way promoting worker ownership however provision meant to be broad enough to reduce federal revenues as much as currently estimated He added The bill I introduced today calls modification provision accordance intended purpose

text.title: AMERICAN EXPRESS AXP SEEN IN POSSIBLE SPINNOFF
text.author: By Patti Domm Reuter
text.body: American Express Co remained silent on market rumors spinoff all or part Shearson Lehman Brothers Inc but some analysts company may be considering such move because unhappy market value stock American Express stock got lift rumor as market calculated partially public Shearson may command good market value thereby boosting total value American Express rumor also accompanied by talk financial services firm split stock boost dividend American Express closed on New York Stock Exchange at up on heavy volume American Express comment on rumors or stock activity Analysts comments by company at analysts meeting Tuesday helped fuel rumors as did announcement yesterday management changes At meeting company officials American Express stock undervalued does fully reflect performance Shearson according to analysts Yesterday Shearson elevating chief operating officer Jeffery Lane to added position president been vacant also created four new positions chairmen operating divisions Analysts speculated partial spinoff make most sense contrary to one variation on market rumors total spinoff Some analysts however disagreed any spinoff Shearson be good since strong profit center American Express contributing pct earnings year I think highly unlikely American Express going to sell shearson Perrin Long Lipper Analytical He questioned what be better investment than a very profitable securities firm Several analysts American Express need cash might be only reason to sell part strong asset But others believe company could very well considered option spinning out part Shearson one rumor suggests selling pct market Larry Eckenfelder Prudential Bache Securities he believes American Express could considered partial spinoff past Shearson being as profitable as fetched big premium market place Shearson s book value dlr range Shearson market place probably be worth three to bilion dlrs terms market capitalization Eckenfelder Some analysts American Express could use capital since plans to expand globally They enormous internal growth plans takes capital You want your stock to reflect realistic valuations to enhance your ability to make all kinds endeavors down road E F Hutton Group analyst Michael Lewis They ve outlined fact they re investing heavily future goes heavily into international arena Lewis That does preclude acquisitions divestitures along way he Lewis if American Express reduced exposure to brokerage business by selling part shearson stock might better reflect other assets such as travel related services business It could find true water mark lesser exposure to brokerage value other components could command higher multiple because they constitute higher percentage total operating earnings company he Lewis Shearson contributed after tax operating earnings up dlrs

text.title: OPEC MAY HAVE TO MEET TO FIRM PRICES ANALYSTS
text.author: BY TED D AFFLISIO Reuters
text.body: OPEC may be forced to meet before scheduled June session to readdress production cutting agreement if organization wants to halt current slide oil prices oil industry analysts The movement to higher oil prices never to be as easy as OPEC thought They may need emergency meeting to sort out problems Daniel Yergin director Cambridge Energy Research Associates CERA Analysts oil industry sources problem OPEC faces excess oil supply world oil markets OPEC s problem price problem but production issue must be addressed way Paul Mlotok oil analyst Salomon Brothers Inc He market s earlier optimism OPEC ability to keep production under control given way to pessimistic outlook organization must address soon if wishes to regain initiative oil prices But some other analysts were uncertain even emergency meeting address problem OPEC production above bpd quota set December OPEC to learn buyers market you cannot deemed quotas fixed prices set differentials regional manager one major oil companies who spoke on condition he be named The market now trying to teach them lesson again he added David T Mizrahi editor Mideast reports expects OPEC to meet before June although immediately However he optimistic OPEC can address principal problems They meet now as they try to take advantage winter demand to sell their oil but late March April when demand slackens Mizrahi But Mizrahi OPEC unlikely to do anything more than reiterate agreement to keep output at bpd Analysts next two months be critical OPEC s ability to hold together prices output OPEC must hold to pact next six to eight weeks since buyers come back into market then Dillard Spriggs Petroleum Analysis Ltd New York But Bijan Moussavar Rahmani Harvard University s Energy Environment Policy Center demand OPEC oil been rising through first quarter may prompted excesses production Demand their OPEC oil clearly above bpd probably closer to bpd or higher now so what we seeing characterized as cheating OPEC meeting reuters.unknown: F A RM f reute r f BC U S FARM CREDIT RESC

text.title: U S FARM CREDIT RESCUE BILL SEEN BEFORE EASTER
text.body: The chairman Senate Agriculture subcommittee on credit panel consider farm credit rescue package by Easter even if system regulator do ask help by then We re going to bill to markup I guarantee you before Easter recess Sen David Boren D Okla Senate Majority leader Robert Byrd D W Va wants recommendations on farm credit presented by April when Congress scheduled to break Easter Boren Boren urged Farm Credit Administration FCA system s regulator to quickly make formal request aid Under Farm credit law passed by Congress FCA as regulator to certify when system exhausted all capital needs federal government help However FCA chairman Frank Naylor because much system s remaining capital tied up legal action he could technically certify rescue needed year perhaps even other Republican member three man FCA board Marvin Duncan agreed But Boren urged even if FCA cannot technically certify aid needed should request help informally We all know we need capital infusion Boren Boren FCA officials spoke at hearing on plight farm credit system Also at hearing Brent Beesely chief executive Farm Credit Council representing system at end system only billion dlrs working capital reuters.unknown: V f reute r f AM REAGAN CABINET

text.title: REPORT COULD BE FINAL BLOW FOR REGAN
text.author: By Sue Baker Reuters
text.body: The Tower Commission s scathing comments on President Reagan s embattled chief staff Donald Regan could signal death knell to his White House tenure but impact strong criticism on two other top officials less clear Regan come tough criticism his handling Reagan s worst political crisis since details covert arms sales to Iran diversion profits to Nicaraguan rebels first emerged November But criticism roles Secretary State George Shultz Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger who they opposed Iran arms initiative yet failed to end been muted until release Tower Commission report Their obligation to give president their full support continued advice respect to program or if they could conscience do to so inform president report after three month probe Instead they simply distanced themselves program They protected record as to their own positions on issue They were energetic attempting to protect president consequences his personal commitment to freeing hostages report saved some most scathing language Regan gruff former Wall Street executive close personal friend Reagan whose autocratic rule White House angered some top Reagan officials perhaps more importantly Reagan s wife Nancy More than almost any chief staff recent memory he asserted personal control over White House staff sought to extend control to national security adviser report Washington analysts Regan s departure now appeared to be only matter timing Many expected president to announce when he addresses nation on Tower Commission s findings next week Regan s departure apparently imminent Poindexter other key figures scandal already out office report s tough criticism Shultz Weinberger could turn spotlight on their future Senate Republican leader Robert Dole key Reagan ally told reporters report disclosed colossal blunders people who served president well should step aside but he did specify who should go It seem to me if you don t protect president you don t serve president well then you should move on Kansas Republican likely presidential candidate next year One Republican strategist he believed Regan be only White House official to leave near future

text.title: FRANCE FACES PRESSUE TO CHANGE POLICIES
text.author: By Brian Childs Reuters
text.body: France s right wing government facing growing pressure to modify economic policies after revising down growth targets revising up inflation forecasts year Moving reluctantly into line most private sector forecasts government yesterday raised inflation estimate half percentage point to per cent cut economic growth estimate to between two per cent per cent target written into annual budget september Finance Minister Edouard Balladur revised figures push government off chosen mix price deregulation budget cutting rigour pay restraint But Trade Union leaders served immediate notice they push to protect purchasing power their members raising spectre vicious spiral wage price rises bank economists contacted by Reuters they believed Prime Minister Jacques Chirac could be forced by slow growth rising unemployment to reflate economy later year perhaps autumn to boost his prospects Presidential elections due by April The outlook more worrying than few weeks ago Societe Generale economist Alain Marais We impression may be difficult to get even two per cent growth year The big question whether government s policy wage moderation be maintained he added government set public sector wage rises at aboout per cent year three per cent ceiling rises justified by increased productivity But head socialist CFDT union federation Edmond Maire meeting Chirac today renewed union demands already rejected by government indexation clauses to be built into future pay contracts to safeguard workers against higher prices Calling government s policies unbalanced unjust he also demanded investment incentives to boost employment He announced after his meeting Chirac told him government spend two billion francs on series measures to boost employment training Andre Bergeron widely respected leader moderate Force Ouvriere labour group put similar demands to Chirac earlier week while Communist led CGT largest France s unions declared defence members earnings top priority But unemployment nearing per cent month still rising government supporters some economic analysts they were confident Chirac could resist union pay demands Salary indexation ended by previous Year partly blamed by government higher inflation undermined unions power popularity he Develle Paribas expected inflation to rise even more than governments revised forecast perhaps to or per cent text.title: PRODUCER SPLIT HEATS UP COFFEE QUOTA TALKS
text.author: By Lisa Vaughan Reuters
text.body: Talks on possibility reintroducing global coffee export quotas been extended into today sparks flying yesterday when dissident group exporters included key negotiating forum special meeting International Coffee Organization ICO council called to find way to stop prolonged slide coffee prices However delegates no solution to question how to implement quotas yet sight World coffee export quotas major device used to regulate coffee prices under International Coffee Agreement were suspended year ago when prices soared reaction to drought cut Brazil s output by nearly two thirds Brazil world s largest coffee producer exporter Producers consumers now facing off over question how quotas should be calculated under any future quota distribution scheme delegates Tempers flared late Saturday when minority group eight producing countries represented contact group five producer five consumer delegates plus alternates set up to facilitate debate big producers want to ball only their court isn t fair minority producer spokesman Luis Escalante Costa Rica majority producer group proposed resuming quotas April using previous ad hoc method carving up quota shares promise to try to negotiate basic quotas before September delegates Their plan perpetuate status quo allowing Brazil to retain almost all current pct share export market Colombia pct Ivory Coast seven pct Indonesia six pct rest divided among smaller exporters But consuming countries dissident producer group tabled separate proposals requiring quotas be determined by availability using formula incorporating exportable production stocks statistics Their proposals give Brazil smaller quota share Colombia Indonesia larger share bring new quota distribution scheme into effect now rather than later Brazil so far been unwilling to accept any proposal reduce quota share delegates Delegates speculate on prospects agreement on quota package Anything possible at phase even adjournment meeting until March or April one If ICO does agree on quotas price coffee on supermarket shelf likely to change sinnificantly as result industry sources Retail coffee prices over past year remained steady even though coffee market prices tumbled so upswing probably be passed onto consumer either they

text.title: INDONESIA SEEN AT CROSSROADS OVER ECONOMIC CHANGE
text.author: By Jeremy Clift Reuters
text.body: Indonesia appears to be nearing political crossroads over measures to deregulate protected economy U S Embassy says new report To counter falling oil revenues government launched series measures over past nine months to boost exports outside oil sector attract new investment Indonesia only Asian member OPEC leading primary commodity producer been severely hit by year s fall world oil prices forced to devalue currency by pct September But U S Embassy report says President Suharto s government appears to be divided over what direction to lead economy It appears to be nearing crossroads regard to deregulation both as pertains to investments imports report says primarily assesses Indonesia s agricultural sector but also reviews country s general economic performance says while many government officials advisers recommending further relaxation there equally strong pressures being exerted to halt all such moves This group strongly favours import substitution economy report says Indonesia s economic changes been welcomed by World Bank international bankers as steps right direction though they say crucial areas economy like plastics steel remain highly protected virtual monopolies Three sets measures been announced since May broadened areas foreign investment reduced trade restrictions liberalised imports report says Indonesia s economic growth calendar probably zero economy may even contracted bit This lowest rate growth since mid s report notes Indonesia largest country South East Asia population million facing general elections April But report hold out little hope swift improvement economic outlook For early indications point to slightly positive growth rate exceeding one pct Economic activity continues to suffer due to sharp fall export earnings petroleum industry Growth non oil sector low because weak domestic demand coupled excessive plant capacity real declines construction trade reduced level growth agriculture report states Bankers say continuation present economic reforms crucial government to get international lending needs new World Bank loan dlrs month balance payments support given partly to help government maintain momentum reform Bank

text.title: INDIAN BUDGET COMES IN FOR WIDE CRITICISM
text.body: Opposition politicians businessmen newspapers criticised India s newly unveiled budget large projected deficit around billion rupees They budget failed to provide incentives economic growth merely tinkered tax reform But few politicians were prepared to criticise sharp rise defence expenditure Hindu majority nation where playing on fear aggression by Moslem Pakistan proved vote winner Indian Express country s biggest selling paper The defence cow never been holier Sunday Mail newspaper branded budget shamelessly political front page commentary budget bad growth bad prices bad stock market neutral respect everything else Businessmen polled by Reuters budget done little them Gandhi announced small increases poverty alleviation education outlays but he ordered hold down on current expenditure attempt to rein budget deficit He told ministries to curb spending promised review money losing public sector industries Gandhi lowered import tariffs on some computer parts but otherwise did little to extended economic liberalisation policy launched two years ago Reaction Bombay India s business capital generally unfavourable Businessmen economists budget no proposals closing budget deficit also failed to boost industrial investment productivity needed to lift real economic growth above five pct year envisaged by development plan Nalin Vissanji President Indian Merchants Chambers Commerce budget gave no incentives to capital market fulfilled government pledge to remove surtax on corporate income Shares on Bombay Stock Exchange India s biggest fell post budget session yesterday but brokers welcomed Gandhi s proposal to set up regulatory board securities industry exchange shaken year by several scandals trading suspended several times Brokers trading volume may increase change capital gains tax on stock sales Stockholders can now sell shares after one year instead three years without incurring capital gains tax Stock Exchange President Ramdas Dalal yesterday fall share prices after budget came as profits were taken he expected to market to firm days to come

instruments should be made available to all citizens institutions Gulf Cooperation Council GCC states Bahrain Kuwait Qatar Oman Saudi Arabia United Arab Emirates UAE Some moves been taken direction week s pause one manager week borrowings totalled billion marks including mark private placement Deutsche Bank Issues all February rose to nearly five billion marks billion January heavy volume also Currently all mark denominated eurobonds to be registered Bundesbank week preceding two week issue period bank may decline to issue bond on requested day calendar but then to wait next calendar period to schedule bond again Some managers they prefer to abolish system Bundesbank shortened reporting period to two weeks four weeks July But few expect calendar to be completely abolished I don t think Bundesbank give up one banking analyst I wouldn t anything against getting rid system analyst adding banks were capable regulating volume new issues themselves Bundesbank plays passive role setting calendar without trying to regulate issues but needs registration to gauge volume mark bonds going through euromarket he reason few managers here foresee Bundesbank sacrificing present calendar system reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC JAPAN PLANS MORE FLEX

text.title: JAPAN PLANS MORE FLEXIBLE CORPORATE BOND ISSUES
text.author: By Yoshiko Mori Reuters
text.body: Japanese securities houses issue new corporate bonds more quickly accept issue requests throughout month instead at month end introduce competitive underwriting method April to bring Japanese firms back to Tokyo bond market securities managers Domestic issues slowed to trickle as more more companies turn to more flexible overseas markets cash but proposed moves expected to pave way review public bond issues they Relaxation issue rules be better applied only to straight corporate bonds but also convertible bonds warrant bonds to call back issuers effectively overseas markets Nikko Securities house bond manager Securities houses launch issue days after corporate declaration intent instead days as now securities managers Underwriters expected to abolish lump sum issuance system all corporate bonds issued at month end accept issue requests during month they Securities houses also plan to introduce free competition among underwriters when negotiating issuers over terms order to better reflect market securities managers Market participants expect new issue methods to be applied beginning April projected issue by Nippon Telegraph Telephone Corp so called proposal method abolishes practice taking lead managership enables more market oriented decisions on terms securities sources four major Japanese securities houses now take turns underwriting corporate bonds Setting issue terms using financial criteria prepared by securities houses reference to coupon rates on latest public bonds now almost automatic they new moves based on wide ranging proposals made late December by advisers to Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa They were aimed at revitalising domestic corporate bond market securities house managers finance ministry commissioned banks securities text.title: JAPAN SALES TAX MAY FORCE NAKASONE OUT OF OFFICE
text.author: By Yuko Nakamikado Reuters
text.body: Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone likely to leave office summer amid opposition to his controversial tax reform package political analysts They Nakasone s reputation as skilled politician suffered irreparable damage his support five pct sales tax planned January Nakasone trying to carry out drastic tax reform at end his administration only impossible but also very irresponsible as politican Rei Shiratori professor politics at Dokkyo University told Reuters Nakasone almost certainly step down as soon as parliament approves sales tax probably summer Shiratori Some ruling Liberal Democratic Party LDP members parliament spoken against tax Nakasone says needed to balance planned cuts income corporate taxes Nakasone today called disciplinary action against LDP members who oppose tax There some who objecting because their constituencies he told meeting government party leaders If party discipline broken I like to see punishment considered A proposed sales tax become political issue partly because Nakasone breached his election pledge against introducing Shiratori Moreover tax being introduced when public feels uncertainty sluggish economy stemming yen s appreciation future when Japanese society rapidly aging he Political analysts controversial tax could affect more than local elections scheduled April involving governors mayors town village heads assemblies at all levels But situation complicated since opposition parties excluding communists sometimes put up joint candidates LDP political analysts added Shiratori In worst case implementation sales tax now scheduled next January may be put off some time before government makes final decision Another alternative to modify planned five pct to perhaps three pct A third alternative government to ram through bills only attendance LDP MPs he Seizaburo Sato professor politics at Tokyo University thought possibility most likely I think LDP alone take vote on tax bills he LDP now holds seats seat Lower House seat Upper House To lure opposition parties back to parliament after LDP pushes through tax bills Nakasone cabinet to resign Sato Boycotting opposition members be more willing to return to parliament if new cabinet been formed he

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT AUSTERITY MEASURES IN HUNGARY
text.author: By David Lewis Reuters
text.body: Hungary to embark on new series austerity measures to tackle budget deficit tripled year after quadrupling target deficit budget approved by Parliament December billion forints But Zoltan Boesze chief Finance Ministry s budget financing division told Reuters government now saw as too high decided quite severe measures were needed All organizations economic management been charged elaborating further savings measures he Asked if these measures were being taken under pressure International Monetary Fund IMF Boesze The Fund suggested be good to improve monetary results course Fund support these efforts IMF teams spent several weeks Budapest late year Boesze preliminary figures showed Hungary s state budget deficit rose to preliminary billion forints year billion billion economy overshot target deficit billion forints because poor performance by state firms needed subsidies tax incentives to export earn hard currency exact extent nature savings still under discussion but subsidies to state enterprises largest budget item must definitely fall Boesze Subsidies to state firms including grants to maintain low consumer prices exceeded plan by nine billion to reach billion forints up billion Parliament approved subsidies billion forints I think quite impossible to keep up former situation we be obliged to reduce subsidies Boesze The central administration must be hard If we hard then we be successful Boesze budget could also make savings reserve provisions two billion forints central expenditure forints transfers to local authorities I believe these reserves should be used at all he Wage growth year outstripped gross domestic product expanded one pct instead planned pct authorities already signalled small fall real wages but Boesze firms suffer severe tax penalties if they award nominal rises over one or two pct mean severe cut living standards as retail price inflation forecast at seven pct after pct four month basic wage freeze expires on April pct subsidies to state enterprises pct were made to maintain low consumer prices Boesze pure economic policy dictate significant cuts price subsidies but social considerations made difficult But he added I think ultimately we be able to make curtailments subsidies area as well He Hungary plans to introduce price reform at beginning at same time as personal taxation value added tax IMF supports these aims Hungary introduced bankrupcty law September attempt to shake out surplus labour inefficient firms Between workers expected to be unemployed at least temporarily by Labour discipline being tightened firms may fire workers more easily Boesze per capita employment tax paid to state by firms being raised year to encourage enterprises to shed labour He gave no exact figures Istvan Nagy senior Finance Ministry official responsible drafting bankrupcy law told Reuters year he hoped law cut state subsidies to enterprises by pct After subsidies to state enterprises largest single budget items social insurance billion forints approved transfers to local councils billion Interest payments on international debt set to rise to more than billion forints between six seven billion Boesze Hungary s net hard currency debt leapt by pct year to billion dlrs according to provisional figures while trade Western countries plunged into deficit more than dlrs billion dlr surplus just two years earlier Boesze year s budget deficit financed pct by credits National Bank mostly abroad pct by issue domestic state bonds Deputy Prime Minister Frigyes Berecz told Hungarian economists speech month country s economy very difficult situation but crisis There to be turnround tangible results year however borrowing must be used more effectively Any rise our present loans may prove to be dangerous Berecz

text.title: DIGITAL AUDIO TAPE PLAYERS GO ON SALE IN JAPAN
text.author: By Steven Brull Reuters
text.body: Japanese consumers hesitated buying controversial digital audio tape player DAT as went on sale Tokyo today but DAT player s near perfect sound make success once becomes cheaper The sound great but I ll wait until more machines hit market prices fall to yen before buying one Terumi Fujitsuka steel firm employee Aiwa Sharp Matsushita displayed their DAT players today although delivery take two weeks retailers Aiwa s machine cheapest listed at yen Machines by Sony Hitachi Toshiba others appear as early as end March industry sources DAT players can play back record fidelity superior to even compact disc They use cassette half size standard audio cassette unlike conventional analogue machines they can make copies infinite number times almost no loss sound quality aroused fears music industry widespread tape piracy loss royalties negotiations delayed DAT player s debut industry demanded anti piracy circuitry be built into machines Machines sold Japan fitted computer chip to prevent copying through digital signal But copies can still be made if signal routed through regular amplifier Nobody can tell difference one salesman DAT players been kept off Western markets some countries considering banning them or imposing heavy duties unless tougher anti piracy circuitry added But Japanese hardware makers hard pressed profits era high yen growing competition eager to carve out profitable niche Prices DAT players probably fall quickly possibly to around yen by next year as other makers put their products on market industry analysts They by sales could reach six units per year Philips Netherlands launch DAT player on world market later year

reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT

text.title: ECONOMIC SPOTLIGHT ITALIAN BOOM
text.author: By Jane Leach Reuters
text.body: Italy s strong economic revival led some observers to talk miracles created euphoria some quarters future growth prospects but many Italian experts warn current wave optimism excessive I think all foreign interest so called Italian miracle really exaggerated Foreign observers always oscillate case Italy between complete pessimism unwarranted optimism says Luigi Spaventa one Italy s leading economists professor at Rome University According to Spaventa these violent swings mood been occurring years Italy one minute seen as bad boy Europe unable to raise dollar next worker miracles basking admiration I think there s lot exaggeration Once used to be underground economy all correspondents foreign newspapers flocked to Italy to study another story nothing like writing black cat dark room Spaventa tune other economists industrialists here stress Italy s recent achievements particularly dramatic solid recovery fortunes industrial enterprises but warns economy still vulnerable Profits private sector firms such as Fiat S P A FIAT M ING C Olivetti C S P A booming major state industries back black after years losses inflation nosedived trade balance payments deficits been slashed Expectations by some experts Italy poised to replace Britain as world s fifth largest economy also boosted optimism Italy itself made clear happy what feels to be second rate status among major industrialised countries Only week angrily demanded clarification status after being excluded meeting finance ministers Group Five G comprising United States Japan West Germany France Britain Italy exclusion meeting violated agreement reached Tokyo year to let Italy Canada attend meetings held by five whenever discussions concerned managing international monetary system But Italy needs first to tackle some fundamental problems still facing economy economists industrialists say We must forget ours still vulnerable economy warns Fiat managing director Cesare Romiti He says while Italy s recent achievements indeed cause satisfaction optimism focus now should be on problems still remaining rather than those already solved country s huge state sector deficit high unemployment heavy dependence on imported oil among most worrying problems experts say size state spending deficit estimated at billion lire targetted at billion lire year means there risk inflation could spiral again says Carlo Scognamiglio head private Luiss university Rome Inflation fell into single digits first time decade September by January year running at pct but still low enough to guarantee international competiveness economists industrialists say unemployment running at pct nationally October according to latest official data Recent official data showed total million people seeking work October almost pct were aged between Unemployment south running at pct more than double industrial north Organisation Economic Cooperation Development OECD recently forecast Italian gross domestic product GDP rise rise three pct after expanding pct But warned growth unlikely to be enough to check rising unemployment Another problem Italy s reliance on imported raw materials country imports around pct fuel needs factor actually worked sharply Italy s favour year when lower energy costs helped slash country s trade deficit to billion lire by year end billion lire But economists say improvement owes little to any structural change Italian economy any reversal trend costs could serious consequences If Italy truly wants to be counted among world s top industrialised nations also needs to tighten up stockmarket operating procedures encourage firms to supply more quality information their activities economists say Italy no controls on insider trading country also needs to shed rigid capital movements controls European Community directive calls these to be dismantled by but too require less blinkered attitude change traditional operating procedures economists say Even today if I wanted to invest Tokyo bourse I doubt I d find expertise brokerage firm or banks allow me to do says Spaventa

text.title: JAPAN U S SET TO BEGIN HIGH LEVEL TRADE TALKS
text.author: By Rich Miller Reuters
text.body: Japan U S Kick off top level trade talks tomorrow amid signs officials both sides growing increasingly irritated each other talks held annually at sub cabinet level to review whole gamut U S Japan economic relations pave way American Secretary State George Schultz s one day stop over here at end week on his way home China Faced growing Congressional protectionist pressure U S Administration pressing Japan speedy action to reduce still huge trade surplus U S Officials We appreciate their frustration senior Japanese government official But we also frustrated official pct rise yen over months hit Japan hard forcing exporters to slash spending lay off workers to make up lost sales abroad yet shown up dollar based statistics on trade but he He U S Administration ignoring progress been made instead emphasizing problems remain when talks Congress It only take five minutes to list their accomplishments senior U S Official replied talks begin tomorrow high level discussions on economic structures both countries how they affect bilateral trade imbalance year amounted to billion dlrs Japan s favour On following two days topics range multilateral trade talks under auspices General Agreement on Tariffs Trade GATT to such bilateral trade problems as super computers structural talks intended to be free wheeling discussions among senior officials Tomorrow s topics include savings investment issues such as consumer credit housing implications government budget deficits These talks come at particularly delicate time Japanese government facing increasing domestic pressure to abandon tight fisted fiscal policy stimulate sagging economy by spending more Some U S Officials complained Japan no intention boosting domestic demand imports as Washington wants Japanese officials turn pointed finger at huge U S Budget deficit as one main culprits trade imbalance budget deficit meant U S buying more imports Japan seems particularly peeved at being singled draft trade bill before Senate as nation following adverserial trade practices It condemns Japan without due process one Japanese official reference spoils what otherwise well thought out bill introduced by Democratic Senator Lloyd Bentsen he Japan also totally happy administration s trade bill particularly proposal to establish reciprocal access to foreign markets as one criteria retaliatory trade action by U S Officials Nevertheless Japanese officials they remain weak bargaining position especially threat trade bill overhanging them We no leverage one official admitted As result Tokyo striving to meet U S Complaints trade practices variety fields including super computers U S pressing greater access to Japanese super computer market Japanese government sent long questionnaire to public institutions like universities buy sophisticated machines hopes eventually setting up informal bidding procedures easily understood by all potential sellers officials

text.body: A rift occured among Philippine officials over debt talks opening tomorrow New York Economic Planning Secretary Solita Monsod accusing chief negotiator softening his stand to gain quick agreement Monsod told Reuters Finance Secretary Jaime Ongpin decided to insist on Manila s creditor banks pledging to fund half projected financing gap seven billion dlrs He Ongpin wants to finish negotiations as fast as possible I m saying s very short sighted Monsod Monsod any pricing agreement on rescheduling billion dlrs Philippines total foreign debt billion dlrs ignore looming billion dlr net resource transfer same period Manila seeking spread percentage points over London Interbank Offered Rates LIBOR Monsod Right now we saying to banks let s share financing burden Ongpin month country s consultative group multilateral bilateral aid donors endorsed growth facility to bridge funding gap He government consultative group meet annually to gauge financing needs each year aid donors commercial bank creditors then be asked to finance any gap on shared basis He told reporters on Saturday be unwise to try to pin banks down on Monsod s proposed growth facility Ongpin acknowledged there dispute over tactics Secretary Monsod I get along famously he She talks I listen but I don t necessarily agree Monsod firm commitment banks on bridging financing gap aided government s pump priming program medium term development plan She if private sector investment continued to be held back by fear balance payments crisis rising interest rates country fail to achieve gross national product GNP growth target average pct over next six years If you don t get those seven billion dlrs there no plan How can there be program if there no finance she adding Ongpin s stand good economy It Ongpin s stand going to make much more difficult economy to attain growth targets Monsod Considering what Philippine negotiating team going to press there absolutely no reason why they should be able to come back from New York day she Monsod government s chief economic planner stressed Manila s policy growth before debt She if banks refused to lend new money Philippines should copy Brazil s action week freezing all debt repayments If banks do cooperate by lending you back some money you sending abroad then course you option Monsod You just don t send abroad You do Brazil

also service debt We must find equilibrium between foreign adjustment internal adjustment Funaro He complained official lending agencies imposed tight control on credit over past four years leaving text.title: REAGAN AND BAKER BEGIN TASK OF REBUILDING
text.author: By Peter Szekely
text.body: After week left his presidency shaken his popularity at new low Ronald Reagan his new chief staff today begin trying to revive administration tattered by Iran contra arms scandal Reagan former Senate Republican leader Howard Baker whose appointment as White House chief staff won bipartisan praise begin mapping strategy to deal scathing criticism by report on his failed bid to trade U S arms Iran help freeing Ameican hostages Lebanon Among chores facing Reagan s new inner circle assessing damage page Tower commission report done to nomination Robert Gates to succeed William Casey as new head Central Intelligence Agency White House officials checking to see how much support Gates year old career spy agency bureaucrat if his nomination submitted to full Senate vote Senate Republican leader Robert Dole Appearing on NBC News program Meet Press Kansas senator Gates nomination could be some difficulty Aides Gates future be given high priority by Baker Even though he deeply implicated arms sale scandal lawmakers Senate confirmation Gates nomination assured even if won come only after months congressional probes into affair He smell Iran on him former Nevada Sen Reagan confidant Paul Laxalt He victim Laxalt appearing on ABC News program This Week David Brinkley bluntly admitted the Gates nomination trouble Senate Armed Services Committee Chairman Sam Nunn odds now slightly against confirmation Gates When asked on syndicated television program John McLaughlin One on One if he thought Gates be confirmed Georgia Democrat shot back I wouldn t bet any money on I think report hurts Nunn It indicates National Security Council policy type influence over intelligence type activities we re going to go into Mr Gates Only day after issued week Tower report prompted abrupt exit Donald Regan as White House chief staff Regan former Wall Street executive Treasury secretary who been president s top aide past two years assigned lion s share blame botched handling Iran arms sale report blamed Regan chaos descended on White House since first revealed November profits Iran arms sales been diverted to contra rebels fighting leftist Nicaraguan government two other victims scandal former National Security Adviser Vice Adm John Poindexter who resigned Marine Lt Col Oliver North who fired after disclosed November profits Iran arms sale were diverted to contras two pictured by Tower commission as key operators Iran arms deal refused to testify Reagan who freely admits disliking details portrayed Tower report as befuddled chief executive whose inattention let his aides run away his foreign policy perception wrecked Reagan s popularity threatened to condemn him to lame duck status until he leaves office January recent Newsweek magazine poll found just pct Americans approved Reagan s leadership record low third believed he should consider resignation After meeting aides over weekend poring over meaty report commission headed by former Texas Sen John Tower Reagan now preparing nationwide television address week to respond to criticisms his presidency

reuters.unknown: C G f reute b f BC USDA LIFTS CROSS COMP
reuters.text: USDA LIFTS CROSS COMPLIANCE FOR CROP OATS REPEAT FROM LATE FRIDAY WASHINGTON Feb The USDA said it is lifting the limited cross compliance requirement for crop oats Deputy Secretary Peter Myers said the action was being taken to help alleviate the short supply of oats Under limited cross compliance the plantings of other program crops on the farm may not exceed the crop acreage bases of those crops The lifting of the cross compliance on oats permits the planting of oats in excess of the oat acreage base without sacrificing eligibility for other crop program benefits Myers said soybean plantings are expected to decrease as a result of the action on oats planting of which are expected to increase by two to three mln acres Reuter

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC BRAZIL CRITICISES ADV

text.title: BRAZIL CRITICISES ADVISORY COMMITTEE STRUCTURE
text.author: By Sandy Critchley Reuters
text.body: Brazil happy existing structure bank advisory committee coordinates commercial bank debt Finance Minister Dilson Funaro U S Banks pct representation on committee while holding only pct Brazil s debt to banks he adding This fair European Japanese banks committee played useful role however Noting often different reactions U S Japanese European banks Funaro told journalists Brazil might adopt approach involving separate discussions regions Since debtor nations problems were normally treated on case by case basis Perhaps same principle should apply to creditors central bank president Francisco Gros Brazil on February suspended indefinitely interest payments on billion dlrs owed to commercial banks followed week by freeze on bank trade credit lines deposited by foreign banks institutions worth some billion dlrs Funaro Gros spent two days at end week Washington talking to government officials international agencies week visit Britain France West Germany Switzerland Italy discussions governments Funaro Gros today meeting British Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson Foreign Secretary Geoffrey Howe Governor Bank England Robin Leigh Pemberton Bankers estimated Brazil owes U K Banks around billion dlrs long medium term loans giving U K third largest exposure after U S Japan crisis began when Brazil s trade surplus chief means servicing foreign debt started to decline sharply problem compounded by renewed surge country s ate inflation Reserves were reported to dropped below four billion dlrs Funaro envisaged any eventual solution to problems Brazil s billion dlr foreign debt involve only partial servicing debt What we propose to arrive at mechanism refinance part service because we cannot service all he I really think we to change old rules Asked why Brazil first approaching governments rather than commercial banks themselves search solution to crisis Funaro We must first talk to governments then we can talk to banks because banks some limits It political discussion our point view he Funaro he hoped next week to travel to talk to Japanese Canadian government officials He then talk to commercial banks If I ve got some solution governments I can t take burden only to banks He sure how long take to reach solution discussions governments Brazil review mechanisms whereby finance made available to nations need Finance official lending agencies been virtually closed since You must open these mechanisms he He while U S Officials been disturbed by Brazil s suspension interest payments they understood Brazil no other choice as to protect reserves Also financing mechanisms to be discussed because we can t stay as we were few years I m trying to put problem on table All us like to kind equilibrium he Although Brazil rejected substantive role International Monetary Fund IMF managing economy Funaro paid call Washington to IMF Managing Director Michel Camdessus to World Bank President Barber Conable Funaro noted inflation February started to decline again he expected Brazil to achieve minimum eight billion dlr trade surplus Banking sources noted Brazil s monthly surplus declined to some dlrs final three months year against monthly one billion first nine months Brazil third largest trade surplus world Funaro although share international trade only one pct The solution linked growth recession he noting IMF program involve promoting exports inducing internal recession order to service debt Banking sources Brazil s debts to foreign governments as opposed to commercial banks now benefit sounder structure following month s rescheduling by Paris Club creditor nations billion dlrs official debt

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC U K SAYS HAS NO ROLE

text.title: U K SAYS HAS NO ROLE IN BRAZIL MORATORIUM TALKS
text.body: U K Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson told Brazil s Finance Minister Dilson Funaro negotiations on Brazil s debt to commercial banks matter commercial banks themselves Treasury spokesman spokesman Chancellor emphasised talks morning Funaro need Brazilian authorities to be able to present convincing economic program to country s creditors He added accord International Monetary Fund IMF could be very helpful support Brazil on February suspended interest payments on billion dlrs debts to commercial banks Lawson s attitude interpreted by banking sources as clear rebuff to Brazilian hopes obtaining official cooperation resolving external debt crisis Funaro accompanied by central bank president Francisco Gros on first leg tour European capitals attempt to explain to governments Brazil s indefinite suspension interest payments earlier month Brazil past rejected substantial role IMF managing economy arguing IMF austerity program by promoting exports dampening domestic consumption lead to recession threaten democracy Funaro Gros week visited Washington as part their trip to enlist support governments attempts to change means by developing countries finance growth Funaro on Saturday Washington Brazil suspended payment on debt if received more faster financing international agencies He earlier today Brazil first approaching governments before talking to commercial banks themselves interest payment moratorium because banks some limits s political discussion our point view Funaro on Friday his talks U S Officials resulted no new financial arrangement to help resolve Brazil s debt crisis describing meeting as initial contact He earlier met Federal Reserve Board Chairman Paul Volcker U S Treasury Secretary James Baker Treasury spokesman pointed out today s talks been at Funaro s request After travelling week to France Germany Switzerland Italy Funaro hopes to visit Canada Japan next week before starting negotiations banks

reuters.unknown: M C f reute u f BC EC COMMISSION GIVEN P

text.title: EC COMMISSION GIVEN PLAN TO SAVE STEEL INDUSTRY
text.author: By Gerrard Raven Reuters
text.body: European Community steelmakers presented Executive Commission controversial plan future industry diplomats say may be forced reluctantly to accept Under plan steel output remain subject to restrictive quotas imports be firmly controlled years to come while steel firms undertook massive slimming down operation to adjust capacity to lower demand Industry Commissioner Karl Heinz Narjes proposed ending quota system by December He proposed return to free market under EC law supposed to exist except times manifest crisis But diplomats some ministers who meet to discuss idea on March argue steel firms crisis their countries orders falling as customers switch to alternative products accounts firmly red Ministers EC s major steel producing countries likely to shy away Narjes proposals could back industry s own plan instead hope minimising political impact plant closures they Industry sources plan presented to Narjes by EC steelmakers lobby group Eurofer retain quota production system at least until end Eurofer statement consultants working identified scope closing plants on voluntary basis to reduce capacity by tonnes year Cuts were still insufficient one production area hot rolled coils further talks were needed Eurofer added industry need support Commission governments carrying out closure program particularly social costs such as redundancy payments EC steel industry already shed jobs decade while reducing annual capacity by tonnes

reuters.unknown: C f reute d f BC CME PLANS RULE CHANGE

text.title: CME PLANS RULE CHANGES TIGHTENING S P TRADING
text.author: By Brad Schade Reuters
text.body: Directors Chicago Mercantile Exchange meet Wednesday to consider membership petition asking exchange to tighten rules covering trading activities widely popular Standard Poor s Stock Index futures pit exchange executive petition calls elimination dual trading legal practice where traders execute customer orders as well as trade their own account But exchange officials noted practice also provides opportunity trader to engage what called front running where traders enter orders their own account before executing orders their customers Leo Melamed CME special counsel directors rule on petition on Wednesday but added special S P Advisory Committee been studying S P futures trading conditions six months expected to submit complete list recommendations within days addition to recommendation on dual trading Melamed special committee also make suggestions possible automatic order entry execution system S P futures futures options rule changes alleviate congested conditions trading pit Melamed directors likely to approve recommendations special committee because most actions board line committee recommendations CME senior vice president Gerald Beyer if board accepts member s petition week rule change be submitted to Commodity Futures Trading Commission approval If board does nothing or rejects petition request rule change must then be submitted to exchange membership vote within days Beyer Melamed also added if petition must be ruled on before recommendations special committee made it confuse issue all traders agree on need to eliminiate or restrict dual trading Although Jonathan Wolff senior vice president at Donaldson Lufkin Jenrette noted dual trading evident on most exchanges It s question integrity person you do business Wolff Futures traders who act as brokers however maintain trading their own accounts necessary order to make up errors they inevitably make when filling customer orders chaotic futures trading pits To absolute ban on dual trading makes difficult broker to function because his errors John Michael vice president at First Options Chicago What comes down to ethics people involved he Furthermore competitive nature futures brokerage makes front running risky to broker s livelihood he If I ever discovered broker doing front running or even suspected him doing I cut him off Michael average broker Treasury bond futures pit instance fill orders to contracts day at dlrs per contract floor sources Even figuring what considered typical pct loss errors such brokerage can be lucrative Front running by brokers only runs market risk adverse price move but also risk losing brokerage business Michael

reuters.unknown: C G f reute d f BC ZIMBABWE S MAIZE MOUN

text.title: ZIMBABWE S MAIZE MOUNTAIN POSES ECONOMIC PROBLEM
text.author: By Peter Gregson Reuters
text.body: More than two tonnes surplus maize dotted across Zimbabwe huge piles posing economic headache country grain Southern Africa s staple been bought by Grain Marketing Board GMB at prices guaranteed before planted costing GMB dlrs month storage interest payments to make purchases Accumulated over past two years bumper harvests surplus represents two years domestic consumption set to grow as further deliveries due shortly Some deals been made aid donors such as European countries Australia to provide Zimbabwe wheat return maize sent to neighbouring Mozambique where United Nations urged greater world efforts to feed hungry But transport constraints keep those figures low only significant dent sale tonnes to South Africa year Because costs incurred GMB cannot afford to give maize away standard kg bags been accumulating economists here But failure to find buyers on glutted world grain markets damaging Zimbabwe as needs foreign exchange to finance imports other areas economy economists added At present no win situation Let us hope some extra aid UN Secretary General Javier Perez de Cuellar called at weekend be spent here Western aid specialist At least year s poor rains haven t exacerbated situation too badly he added Rainfall during current rainy season been far below average ravaging all but irrigated lands large commercial farmers While may curb amount maize delivered year to GMB government also acted late year to slash maize production force diversification Calling switch to other crops such as oilseeds Agriculture Minister Moven Mahachi economically viable price dlrs tonne be paid year only half amount maize bought by GMB above growers be paid unprofitable dlrs poor rains also adversely affected other crops such as sorghum soybeans groundnuts tobacco cotton Agriculture Ministry reported at end February

reuters.unknown: F f reute d f BC TECHNOLOGY

text.title: TECHNOLOGY CHIP INDUSTRY SEEKS CUSTOM DESIGNS
text.author: By Catherine Arnst Reuters
text.body: U S semiconductor manufacturers struggling to stem river red ink increasingly looking toward customized designs rather than mass market chips future profits market customized chips semiconductors designed very specific application or product expected to expand by to pct year compared only six pct entire integrated circuit industry Market researcher Dataquest Inc estimates sales customized chips totaled billion dlrs worldwide year pct total chip market By however customized chips expected to represent billion to billion dlr market pct total chip sales More important their vendors because they standard design customized chips represent sellers market prices profit margins can be set accordingly High volume memory chips become a perfect commodity market Robert Brodersen professor electrical engineering at University California at Berkeley told industry forum The product interchangeable between one manufacturer another customers base their buying decisions almost entirely on price Brodersen He predicted next few years only handful world s largest chip manufacturers most them Japanese produce memory chips standard electronic component found everything digital watches to computers The rest industry just won t be involved week s International Solid State Circuits Conference chip industry s annual forum new developments seemed to support Brodersen s prediction papers presented at conference some pct Japanese authors first time they outnumberd United States Most Japanese chip designs were memory category including Nippon Telephone Telegraph Co s attention grabbing bit dynamic random access memory dram chip times more powerful than anything now available most advanced memory chip described by U S company International Business Machine Corp s IBM four bit chip IBM only manufactures chips own internal use open market problem memory chips they all based on same well known design standards so they easy to copy inexpensive to manufacture Because such large Japanese conglomerates as Sony Corp SNE NEC Corp NIPNY Matushita Mitsui their own enormous consumer electronics product lines they also guaranteeed internal market their chips so they can produce huge amounts at very low cost per unit Customized chips however designed specific customer manufactured small quantities expensive relative to standard chips Computer markets increasingly looking to customized chips because they difficult to copy thus making final product harder to clone as well Intel Corp INTC leading manufacturer microprocessors form brains most computers alerted industry to intention to switch to customized chips fall company just reported loss spend dlrs over next three years to turn itself into leading manufacturer custom semi custom chips Intel joins some companies already competing piece customized chip business but advantage others do IBM owns pct stake Intel agreed to share designs many chips makes own use Intel customize those designs sell them to others also get to use IBM s proprietary computer system designing chips considered by experts to be one most advanced world Intel s success still guaranteed however Industry analysts noted far different to design mass market item than customized chip requires close working relationship customer Intel spent five years dlrs developing newest microprocessor much faster turnarouond time much lower development costs be required customized chips if firm to succeed

text.body: The U S Department Transportation DOT concluded ban on smoking on all domestic airline flights justified at time department made known conclusions report to Congress made public today on recommendation by National Academy Sciences such ban be adopted We agree exposure to environmental tobacco smoke could be viewed as problem by some crew passengers However we believe further study needed before department can propose definitive response to recommendation DOT report National Academy Sciences NAS studied issue smoking on airlines under DOT grant recommended ban August after concluding tobacco smoke when confined to airliner s cabin posed potential health hazards to cabin crew members irritated passengers crew created risk fires DOT more study needed health effects environmental tobacco smoke concentration distribution pollutants on various aircraft types also called more study possible changes aircraft ventilation systems wanted to spend more time considering whether ban should be extended to international as well as domestic flights

text.title: NYMEX WILL EXPAND OFF HOUR TRADING APRIL ONE
text.author: By BERNICE NAPACH Reuters
text.body: The New York Mercantile Exchange set April one debut new procedure energy complex increase use energy futures worldwide On April one NYMEX allow oil traders do hold futures position to initiate after exchange closes transaction can subsequently be hedged futures market according to exchange spokeswoman This change way oil transacted real world Thomas McKiernan McKiernan Co chairman Foreign traders be able to hedge trades against NYMEX prices before exchange opens negotiate prices at differential to NYMEX prices McKiernan explained expanded program will serve industry because oil market does close when NYMEX does Frank Capozza secretary Century Resources Inc rule change already taken effect platinum futures on NYMEX expected to increase open interest liquidity U S energy futures according to traders analysts Currently at least one trader transaction called exchange physical or EFP must hold futures position before entering into transaction Under new arrangement neither party to hold futures position before entering into EFP one or both parties can offset their cash transaction futures contract next day according to exchange officials When NYMEX announced proposed rule change December NYMEX President Rosemary McFadden Expansion EFP provision add to globalization energy markets by providing effect hour trading Commodity Futures Trading Commission approved rule change February according to CFTC spokeswoman

text.title: THREE CONVICTED IN HOME STATE FAILURE
text.body: Marvin Warner two fellow officers former Home State Savings Bank were convicted on charges connected collapse Home State Warner owner Home State found guilty six counts performing unauthoriazed acts investing some Home State money without authorization board directors three counts securities violations collapse He acquitted on counts willful misapplication Burton Bongard former Home State president convicted all counts willful misapplication David Schiebel also former president convicted on three four counts securities violations but acquitted on charges willful misapplication corrects warner s conviction irregularities men were charged led to state imposed moratorium on all state insured savings loan companies Ohio lifted on individual basis as firms were able to show proof their solvency Judge Richard Niehaus Hamilton County Common Pleas Court ordered Warner jailed lieu dlrs bond He set dlr bond Bongard dlr bond Schiebel pending appearance trio sentencing March Lawrence Kane special prosecutor Warner Bongard could receive maximum years prison He Schiebel could receive maximum to years on his convictions All three were accused draining dlrs Home State funds through investments ESM Government Securities Inc Fort Lauderdale Fla went bankrupt triggered collapse Home State On March Ohio Governor Richard Celeste closed all state s privately insured savings loan companies they remained closed until they could obtain federal deposit insurance or merge other companies federal deposit insurance

reuters.unknown: V RM f reute u f BC REGAN DEPARTURE MAKES

text.title: REGAN DEPARTURE MAKES RD VOLCKER TERM LIKELY
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: Last week s White House shake up increased odds Federal Reserve Board chairman Paul Volcker symbol strength government reeling arms to Iran scandal serve third term sources close to Fed say But they no decision on appointment must be filled August been taken by White House Volcker too made up his mind Former White House Chief Staff Donald Regan who resigned week when ex senator Howard Baker named as his replacement implacably opposed to Volcker tried often to undermine him open secret Washington Regan tried to ensure Volcker first appointed by President Carter be offered third term by President Reagan Only Volcker s key allies Reagan administration Vice President George Bush Treasury Secretary James Baker kept Regan s recent maneuvering at bay sources Sources close to administration say Regan leaked story quickly shot down by others administration Beryl Sprinkel chairman council economic advisers been chosen to replace Volcker But as administration s credibility increasingly under fire became clear Regan s power to bring such changes on wane sources New White House Chief Staff Howard Baker very good relationship his namesake at Treasury Department likely to respect his views on Fed chairmanship As moderate Republican Baker also unlikely to share right wing s opposition to Volcker This new White House going to need all strength can get one source when asked possibility Volcker s reappointment Paul Volcker deeply respected financial markets both United States around world At time when stability dollar viability major debtor nations question Volcker s departure definitely undermine U S leadership foreign exchange analysts say U S officials say Volcker works very closely Treasury Secretary Baker on issues like international debt global economic cooperation two men seem only to differ on how far to deregulate banking industry but recent statements by Volcker he adopted more liberal attitude on deregulation signalled politically independent central bank coming around at least partially to Treasury position recent statement by Reagan administration official two men saw exactly eye to eye on dollar seen as indication Baker s support Fed chairman Baker understood to played key role Volcker s reappointment to Fed mid sources Baker respects Volcker when appointed Treasury Secretary February he decided to ensure good working relationship part because he believed two key government economic institutions to work closely Regan Treasury Secretary during President Reagan s first term formerly head Wall Street s largest brokerage firm Merrill Lynch came to Washington determined to be America s pre eminent economic spokesman He developed deep antipathy Volcker whose political skills undermined ambition who financial markets took text.author: By Lisa Vaughan Reuters
text.body: The failure International Coffee Organization ICO to reach agreement on coffee export quotas could trigger massive selloff London coffee futures at least stg per tonne today coffee trade sources Prices could easily drop to as low as dlr or even cents lb year around dlrs now they special meeting between importing exporting countries ended deadlock late yesterday after eight days talks over how to set quotas No further meeting to discuss quotas set delegates Quotas major device used to stabilize prices under International Coffee Agreement were suspended year ago after prices soared following damaging drought Brazil no propects quotas sight heavy producer selling initially price war among commercial coffee roasting companies ensue trade sources predicted Lower prices sure to trickle down to supermarket shelf spring coffee dealers U S Brazil largest coffee importer exporter respectively each laid blame on other breakdown talks Jon Rosenbaum U S Assistant trade representative delegate to talks statement after council adjourned A majority producers led by Brazil were prepared to negotiate new distribution based on objective criteria We want to insure countries receive export quotas based on their ability to supply market instead their political influence ICO Brazilian Coffee Institute IBC President Jorio Dauster countered Negotiations failed because consumers tried to dictate quotas negotiate them Previously quotas were determined by historical amounts exported gave Brazil pct share global market kilo bags majority producers wanted quotas to continue under basic scheme But most consumers maverick group eight producers proposed carving up export market on basis exportable production stocks reduce Brazil s share to pct Consumer delegates method reflect changes many countries export capabilities make coffee more readily available to consumers when they need minute attempt by Colombia second largest exporter to rescue talks compromise interim proposal could bring two sides together Delegates speculated Brazil s financial problems illustrated by recent suspension interest payments on bank debt increased political pressure on country to protect coffee export earnings Developing coffee producing countries depend heavily on coffee earnings particularly some African nations Colombia likely to be hurt most by ICO s failure to agree quotas analysts expected drop prices could result losses as much as three billion dlrs year producer delegates forecast ICO executive board meet March but full council due to meet again until September delegates

text.author: By Chaitanya Kalbag Reuters
text.body: The Philippines must devalue peso if wants exports to remain competitive Economic Planning Secretary Solita Monsod told Reuters The peso dollar rate to be undercut to make our exports more competitive Monsod interview No question I m saying you cannot argue success Taiwan South Korea West Germany Japan all those miracle economies deliberately undervalued their currencies peso been free floating since June currently at to U S Dollar Finance Secretary Jaime Ongpin government does intend to devalue peso wants to be flexible able to continue to respond to market conditions Monsod Ongpin looking at exchange rate point view finance If dollar rate goes higher our debt service terms pesos gets higher so financing very difficult she But I am looking at terms economy She she trying to oppose official policy I m just saying keep competitive I do want to become uncompetitive because then we dead Monsod The ideal movement peso dollar rate movement reflect differences inflation rates Philippines versus other country s arithmetic thing Official figures show Philippine inflation averaged pct calendar Ongpin told reporters on Saturday expected to touch five pct year He government International Monetary Fund set peso dollar target rate at peso lost pct value to slump to to dollar when floated
