text.title: JAPAN LIKELY TO LET U S BANKS DEAL SECURITIES
text.author: By Tsukasa Maekawa Reuters
text.body: Japan looks likely to allow U S Banks to conduct securities business here move probably cause barriers separating Japanese commercial banks brokerage houses to break down financial analysts But timing approval remains uncertain due to conflicting domestic interests J P Morgan Co JPM Bankers Trust New York Corp BT Manufacturers Hanover Corp MHC Chemical Bank New York Corp CHL expected to win approval to conduct securities business Japan U S Bank officials There no reason extended delay approval one official at U S Bank four U S Banks been seeking finance ministry approval months To date Japan allowed European banks to do securities business here through pct owned subsidiaries As Japanese banks can conduct securities business European countries seen as reciprocal move did pave way Japanese banks to enter domestic securities market But if U S Banks win approval Japanese banks press hard similiar status since they allowed to conduct securities business U S Many U S Bank officials expect their applications to be approved before June But Japanese banking sources decision be delayed until next year spokesman finance ministry declined comment U S Bankers meet ministry officials talks on financial market deregulation sometime next few months Ministry sources talks likely to be held April or June At round financial negotiations September U S Officials Japan s commitment to deregulation flagging Analysts finance ministry been seriously considering U S Request since U S Federal Reserve Bank New York approved five new primary government securities dealers including two Japanese brokerages December They ministry to approve U S Request soon to head off criticism markets as open to foreigners as those U S Analysts Japan proceeded rapidly financial deregulation since but touched upon clear division between securities banking businesses Japanese banks securities houses fought hard to protect their interests but analysts banks finding increasingly difficult to earn money traditional fields Officials major Japanese banks they pay special attention to ministry s reaction to U S Bank requests because approval accelerate market liberalization Japan Japanese bankers hope approval pave way their own entry into domestic securities market

trade deficits U S Out inaccurate Peking itself to persuade Congress to change laws limit exports official International Business newspaper today published China s demands editorial to coincide visit U S Secretary State George Shultz It extremely important U S Market reduce restrictions on Chinese imports provide needed facilities them businessmen both sides help to expand Chinese exports editorial The U S Should quickly discard prejudice against favourable tariff treatment Chinese goods admit China into Generalised System Preference GSP Despite easing curbs on U S Technology exports recent years control them still extremely strict influences normal trade between two countries added paper also printed article by China s commercial counsellor Washington embassy Chen Shibiao who all kinds difficulties restrictions were preventing bilateral trade fulfilling full potential He named them as U S Protectionist behaviour curbs on technology transfer out of date trade legislation paper also printed table showing since bilateral trade began China deficit every year except shows deficits at billion billion dlrs U S Embassy official U S Did accept Peking s trade figures at all mainly because they exclude goods shipped to Hong Kong then trans shipped to U S While U S Figures based on country origin He if China wants to obtain GSP status to lobby Congress itself to persaude to amend several laws currently prevent Peking getting such status U S Trade Act says to qualify GSP China must be member General Agreement Tariffs Trade GATT applied July not be dominated or controlled by international Communism official China well aware laws some date to anti Communist early s but there sufficient political U S To change them China been subject dozen cases involving anti dumping U S Within two years U S Side won he But first time China signed week agreement itself initiated to voluntarily restrain exports at least two categories steel goods may lead U S Side to withdraw anti dumping case he added Another diplomat willingness to provide such voluntary export restraints be important issue bilateral trade issues Peking s application to GATT China potential to disrupt world markets especially textiles Other GATT countries be nervous China respect But there precedent other centralled planned economies GATT diplomat Poland Czechoslovakia Hungary Romania members GATT but none China s massive market potential imports or vast labour pool to produce cheap exports speech today northeast city Dalian U S Secretary State George Shultz his country welcomed China s interest participating GATT The process Chinese accession be accomplished overnight GATT rules were designed large economy Chinese type Shultz China can play important role by actively joining GATT discussions seeking to expand general trading opportunities enhance market access exports worldwide China can further develop foreign trade system so as to gain maximum benefit GATT participation he problems facing U S China trade GATT membership similar pricing system many foreign businessmen regard as arbitrary related to actual costs especially exports de facto dual currency system memorandum backing application presented to GATT month China gradually reforming economic system replacing mandatory instruction guidance planning economic levers diplomat to join GATT China much to do

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC GERMAN BANKS SEEK GRE

text.title: GERMAN BANKS SEEK GREATER BRAZIL LINK WITH IMF
text.author: By Anthony Williams Reuters
text.body: West German banks like Brazil to work more closely International Monetary Fund IMF view to seeking solution to country s debt problems senior West German banking sources sources speaking ahead meeting later today between Brazilian Finance Minister Dilson Funaro his West german counterpart Gerhard Stoltenberg also believed Brazil should come up convincing economic recovery program Their comments echoed those British Chancellor Exchequer Nigel Lawson who met Funaro yesterday Funaro currently on European trip seeking to involve governments negotiations commercial banks on rescheduling part Brazil s foreign debt totals some billion dlrs But Lawson told Funaro Brazil to solve problems banks rather than governments Diplomatic sources Bonn Funaro leave early tomorrow morning Zurich after meeting Stoltenberg evening Funaro rejected suggestions negotiations IMF there no question Brazil agreeing to austerity program Fund However West German banking sources institutions here felt particularly important Brazil presented credible recovery program there be rapprochement IMF Consultations least can be expected one banker Funaro s trip follows decision by Brazil days ago to suspend interest payments on billion dlrs commercial debt also frozen bank credit lines deposited by foreign banks institutions worth billion dlrs One senior banker closely involved Brazilian debt negotiation offered qualified support call Funaro change structure advisory committee banks coordinated Brazilian debt since Funaro yesterday U S Banks holding pct Brazilian debt were over represented on bank advisory committee pct committee seats He Brazil might adopt different approach to creditor banks involving separate discussions regions Such move be Brazil s interest since European banks been more supportive than U S Banks alternative debt solutions such as interest capitalisation senior banker strongly opposed to purely regional approach saying There must be one committee one solution But he added There must be understanding special requests special regions be taken into account German banks objected to fact idea interest capitalisation been rejected committee imperative alternative options be considered The menu must become richer banker Banking sources commercial banks be involved today s talks Funaro spokesman Bundesbank Frankfurt central bank also be represented West German banks taken more relaxed attitude to Brazilian suspension interest payments than institutions United States because their lower exposure According to Bundesbank data September year West German bank exposure to Latin America slightly under billion marks represented less than five pct all foreign credit

text.body: President Corazon Aquino announced government plans to devote to land reform estimated billion pesos about one billion U S Dlrs raised sale failed businesses taken over by government Aquino she willing to her family s sugar estate broken up compliance Philippine land reform programmes but hinted be offered voluntarily Whatever laws be enacted I say nobody above law includes me My brothers sisters Filipino citizens We abide by whatever laws enacted as far as sugar land concerned she told reporters committee now formulating guidelines plan including question whether land operated by multinational companies should also be covered she added Agrarian Reform Secretary Heherson Alvarez recently government planned to distribute hectares land to impoverished farmworkers under revised land reform programme plan requiring billion dlrs now also covers sugar coconut areas apart rice corn lands he expected to benefit three landless peasants he added Land reform pressure groups called on Aquino to break up her family s hectare sugar estate to demonstrate her sincerity on issue political analysts called one most pressing problems facing Philippines known whether government wait Congress to convene by mid year to formalise programme or Aquino carry out through executive order Under plan government purchase land mainly landowners holdings over seven hectares include vacant untenanted farmland as well as hectares seized former associates deposed president Ferdinand Marcos

text.title: OPEC WITHIN OUTPUT CEILING SUBROTO SAYS
text.body: Opec remains within agreed output ceiling barrels day expected current fluctuations spot market one or two dlrs Indonesian Energy Minister Subroto He told reporters after meeting President Suharto present weakness spot oil market result warmer weather U S Europe reduced demand oil Prices also been forced down because refineries were using up old stock he He denied Opec exceeding agreed production ceiling Asked what Opec s output level now he replied Below mln barrels per day He did elaborate He there appeared to been some attempts to manipulate market but if all Opec members stick by cartel s December pricing agreement get through present price difficulties He predicted prices recover again third fourth quarters He also reiterated there no need emergency Opec meeting He Opec expected to see some fluctuations spot price We hope weak price be overcome predict price be better third fourth quarters Refiners he appeared to used up old stock deliberately to cause slack demand market price to fall But Opec get through period if members stuck together

text.title: JAPAN S UNEMPLOYMENT RATE SEEN RISING TO PCT
text.author: By Jeff Stearns Reuters
text.body: Japan s unemployment rate expected to continue to climb to pct within next year January s three pct record senior economists including Susumu Taketomi Industrial Bank Japan December s pct previous worst level since government s Management Coordination Agency began compiling statistics under current system There general fear we become country high unemployment Takashi Kiuchi senior economist Long Term Credit Bank Japan Ltd government published January unemployment figures today did make any predictions At present we do forecast unemployment rate year but difficult to foresee situation improving Labour Ministry official Finance Minister Kiichi Miyazawa government expected increase set aside money to help people find jobs fiscal beginning April Prime Minister Yasuhiro Nakasone told press conference record rate underlines need to pass budget been held up by opposition to proposed tax reforms yen s surge caused layoffs mainstay steel shipbuilding industries Other export dependent industries such as cars textiles laid off part time employees ceased hiring economists Although growing service industry sector absorbed great number workers trend starting to slow down Koichi Tsukihara Deputy General Manager Sumitomo Bank Ltd s economics department However other economists disagreed saying service sector be able to hire workers no longer needed by manufacturing sector over next five years

reuters.unknown: V f reute u f BC REGAN DEPARTURE MAKES

text.title: REGAN DEPARTURE MAKES RD VOLCKER TERM LIKELY
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: Last week s White House shake up increased odds Federal Reserve Board chairman Paul Volcker symbol strength government reeling arms to Iran scandal serve third term sources close to Fed say But they no decision on appointment must be filled August been taken by White House Volcker too made up his mind Former White House Chief Staff Donald Regan who resigned week when ex senator Howard Baker named as his replacement implacably opposed to Volcker tried often to undermine him open secret Washington Regan tried to ensure Volcker first appointed by President Carter be offered third term by President Reagan Only Volcker s key allies Reagan administration Vice President George Bush Treasury Secretary James Baker kept Regan s recent maneuvering at bay sources Sources close to administration say Regan leaked story quickly shot down by others administration Beryl Sprinkel chairman council economic advisers been chosen to replace Volcker But as administration s credibility increasingly under fire became clear Regan s power to bring such changes on wane sources New White House Chief Staff Howard Baker very good relationship his namesake at Treasury Department likely to respect his views on Fed chairmanship As moderate Republican Baker also unlikely to share right wing s opposition to Volcker This new White House going to need all strength can get one source when asked possibility Volcker s reappointment Paul Volcker deeply respected financial markets both United States around world At time when stability dollar viability major debtor nations question Volcker s departure definitely undermine U S leadership foreign exchange analysts say U S officials say Volcker works very closely Treasury Secretary Baker on issues like international debt global economic cooperation two men seem only to differ on how far to deregulate banking industry but recent statements by Volcker he adopted more liberal attitude on deregulation signalled politically independent central bank coming around at least partially to Treasury position recent statement by Reagan administration official two men saw exactly eye to eye on dollar seen as indication Baker s support Fed chairman Baker understood to played key role Volcker s reappointment to Fed mid sources Baker respects Volcker when appointed Treasury Secretary February he decided to ensure good working relationship part because he believed two key government economic institutions to work closely Regan Treasury Secretary during President Reagan s first term formerly head Wall Street s largest brokerage firm Merrill Lynch came to Washington determined to be America s pre eminent economic spokesman He developed deep antipathy Volcker whose political skills undermined ambition who financial markets took much more seriously But sources Volcker to be invited to stay Is president going to ask him he wouldn t stay otherwise one He d to be asked Stephen Axilrod formerly staff director monetary policy at Fed now vice chairman Nikko Securities Co International Otherwise list potential candidates awe inspiring if Volcker left Augsut he leave behind one most inexperienced Fed Boards years Many analysts believe lack collective experience four sitting members were all appointed within three years dangerous coming at time when global economy threatened by instability experienced successor therefore seem necessity One widely mentioned possibility Secretary State George Shultz whose experience as Treasury Secretary under Preesident Nixon background as trained economist make him ideal But Shultz too may been damaged by arms to Iran scandal while vice chairman Manuel Johnson regarded at years old as too young job Other potential candidates include economist Alan Greenspan frequently informal presidential economic adviser New York Fed President E Gerald Corrigan Federal Deposit Insurance Corp chairman William Seidman Sprinkel Long Regan protege Sprinkel s chances may be damaged by his patron s departure White House

text.body: This morning s sharp decline coffee prices following breakdown late night negotiations London to reintroduce International Coffee Organization ICO quotas be short lived Dutch roasters The fall technical emotional reaction to failure to agree on reintroduction ICO export quotas but be long before reality reasserts itself prices rise again spokesman one major Dutch roasters The fact while there ample supplies coffee available at present there shortage quality he Average prices fell to around cents lb following news breakdown but we expect them to move back again to around cents within few weeks roaster added Dutch Coffee Roasters Association secretary Jan de Vries although roasters were disappointed at failure consumer producer ICO representatives to agree on quota reintroduction equally important quotas be reallocated on more equitable basis There no absolute need quotas at moment because market well balanced we must lose opportunity to renegotiate coffee agreement he There still lot work to be done on number clauses International Coffee Agreement we welcome quota reintroduction until we complete renegotiation de Vries added mind Dutch roasters claiming to fairly good forward cover buying strategy foreseeable future probably be to buy coffee on hand to mouth basis on sliding scale when market prices were below cents lb roasters

text.body: H J Heinz HNZ N chairman Tony O Reilly be interested buying Guinness PLC GUIN L s brewery division if were sale spokesman spokesman reacting to Irish British press reports He continues to be interested were group to offer brewery side Guinness sale But he put together consortium nor he been buying shares He quoted by Irish magazine Business Finance as saying he be interested if came on market he support two international banks if he decided such purchase might be worthwhile magazine article he suggested if brewing profits were calculated to be region punts asking price be higher than punts A multiple ten times earnings be top whack brewing division current Guinness situation he This mean expensive exercise right on edge but impossible he added deal mean buying Dublin London Nigerian Malaysian breweries because It could only be sold as integral unit if going to be sold at all O Reilly

text.title: EARTHQUAKES CONTINUE IN NORTHERN NEW ZEALAND
text.body: Earthquakes aftershocks still shaking areas northern New Zealand following yesterday s strong tremor left people homeless Four earthquakes measuring up to on Richter scale hit Bay Plenty Waikato region north east since midnight yesterday GMT No casualties been reported no further major damage civil defence sources government seismologist Rotorua North Island some five tremors were being recorded every minutes seismologist if pattern other large earthquakes followed shocks continue one to several weeks declining frequency magnitude But chance further large shock could be ruled out

reuters.unknown: G T C f reute r f BC U S ASKS JAPAN TO EN

text.title: U S ASKS JAPAN END AGRICULTURE IMPORT CONTROLS
text.body: The U S Wants Japan to eliminate import controls on agricultural products within three years visiting U S Under Secretary State Economic Affairs Allen Wallis told Eishiro Saito Chairman Federation Economic Organisations Keidanren spokesman Keidanren spokesman quoted Wallis as saying drastic measures be needed to stave off protectionist legislation by Congress Wallis who attending sub cabinet level bilateral trade meeting made remark yesterday talks Saito Wallis quoted as saying Reagan Administration wants Japanese cooperation so White House can ensure any U S Trade bill moderate one rather than containing retaliatory measures or antagonising any particular country He also quoted as saying U S be pleased were Japan to halve restrictions on agricultural imports within five years if country cannot cope abolition within three spokesman Japan currently restricts imports agricultural products ban on rice imports triggered recent U S Complaints Japan s agricultural policy
